Container.Name: RTLSDR-Airband
Container.Overview: This container runs an Icecast audio server that RTLSDR-Airband can connect to so that you can use an RTLSDR dongle to listen to Air Traffic Control VHF radio communications, as well some some additional kinds of NFM modulated transmissions (see NFM) via a web browser or audio playback program.
Container.Category: MediaApp:Audio MediaServer:Audio Productivity: Tools: Other: Status:Stable
Container.ExtraSearchTerms: rtl-sdr rtl sdr airband adsb icecast radio antenna

Config.Name: API Port
Config.Description: Container Port: 8000

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Dongle
Config.Description: USB device to use for the RTLSDR

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Gain
Config.Description: Gain to use for the RTLSDR

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Correction
Config.Description: Use this if your dongle has a non-zero frequency tuning error, which requires correcting. Put correction value in ppm here. If the dongle tunes too high, this value shall be positive, negative otherwise.

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Serial
Config.Description: Used to have rtlsdr-airband use the correct dongle if more than one present. Enter the serial of the dongle to be used. Leave empty otherwise.

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Mode
Config.Description: If you are tuning a single frequency, set multichannel. If you are tuning more than one, set as scan

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Frequency
Config.Description: If you are setting multichannel for your mode, enter a single frequency. If you are setting mode as scan, enter a comma separated list of frequencies you want to scan.

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Stream Name
Config.Description: Name of the stream

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Stream Genre
Config.Description: Genre of the stream

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Stream Description
Config.Description: Description of the stream

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Show Metadata
Config.Description: If not set, the Icecast server will receive updated metadata (either frequency or a specific label) of the frequency that is being received, and will show in playback clients. It might be advantageous to disable this because updated metadata will clutter up the Icecast server logs. To disable, set to any value. Not applicable to multichannel mode.

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Labels
Config.Description: If Show Metadata is set to true, you can set this variable to a comma separated list of labels associated with the frequencies you are listening to. If set, the metadata on the icecast server will be updated to show the label associated with the frequency that is currently being received. If not set, the Icecast metadata will be updated with the frequency.

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Mount Point
Config.Description: The custom part of the stream URL. Streams will be accessible at serverip:PORT/MOUNTPOINT

Config.Name: Prometheus - Enable
Config.Description: Set to any value to enable rtlsdr-airband generation of Prometheus formatted channel usage statistics

Config.Name: Prometheus - Port
Config.Description: Port for the Prometheus server to listen on

Config.Name: Icecast - Disable
Config.Description: Set to any value to disable Icecast functionality

Config.Name: Icecast - Hostname
Config.Description: Icecast hostname

Config.Name: Icecast - Admin Username
Config.Description: Icecast admin username

Config.Name: Icecast - Admin Password
Config.Description: Icecast admin password

Config.Name: Icecast - Admin Email
Config.Description: Icecast admin email

Config.Name: Icecast - Location
Config.Description: Icecast location

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Build Platform
Config.Description: On the container's first run, the rtl_airband binary will be built with platform-specific optimisation if this is set. It can be set to rpiv2, generic or native

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Radio Type
Config.Description: Type of dongle that is providing the radio tuning

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Log Scanned Activity
Config.Description: rtlsdr-airband can output what frequencies it has received traffic on. Set this to any non-blank value to enable

Config.Name: RTLSDR - FFT Size
Config.Description: This value controls the general audio quality. A larger value means increased CPU usage. Accepted values are powers of two in the range of 256-8192, inclusive.

Config.Name: RTLSDR - Sample Rate
Config.Description: Set the sample rate of the audio stream.

Config.Name: RTLSDR - NFM Support
Config.Description: Set to any value to build the rtl_airband binary with NFM support.

Config.Name: Icecast - Max Clients
Config.Description: Max Icecast listeners

Config.Name: Icecast - Max Sources
Config.Description: Maximum number of clients that can provide a stream to the Icecast server
